{"step_by_step_thinking": "Class II division 1 malocclusion is a type of dental misalignment where the upper front teeth are positioned further forward than the lower front teeth. This results in an overbite, where the upper teeth overlap the lower teeth excessively. Given this information, we can determine the answer by considering the position of the lips. In class II division 1 malocclusion, the upper front teeth are more prominent, which can cause the upper lip to appear hypertonic or more tense. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Hypertonic upper Lip.", "answer_choice": "C"}
